Gemini จะถอนตัวจากสหราชอาณาจักร สหภาพยุโรป และออสเตรเลีย ลดพนักงานลง 25% และเน้นที่ตลาดสหรัฐอเมริกาและตลาดพยากรณ์

Gemini to exit U.K., EU and Australia, reduce staff by 25%, and focus on U.S. and prediction markets

1d ago//Olivier Acuna
general
AI

Summary

TH

บริษัท Gemini Space Station Inc. (GEMI) ประกาศว่าจะยุติการดำเนินงานในสหราชอาณาจักร สหภาพยุโรป และออสเตรเลียภายในเดือนเมษายน 2026 พร้อมกับลดจำนวนพนักงานลง 25% ทางบริษัทได้ระงับการฝากเงินและการเปิดบัญชีใหม่ในพื้นที่เหล่านี้ โดยแนะนำให้ลูกค้าลงทะเบียนกับ eToro ก่อนสิ้นเดือนมีนาคมเพื่อช่วยโอนสินทรัพย์ออกจากระบบ ทั้งนี้ ผู้ก่อตั้งอย่าง Tyler และ Cameron Winklevoss ระบุว่าการถอนตัวจากตลาดเหล่านี้เกิดจากความยากลำบากในการขยายฐานลูกค้า ซึ่งจะช่วยให้บริษัทสามารถจัดสรรทรัพยากรใหม่ได้อย่างมีประสิทธิภาพ ในอนาคต Gemini วางแผนที่จะมุ่งเน้นที่ตลาดสหรัฐฯ และขยายเข้าสู่ตลาด Prediction Markets (ตลาดทำนายผล) ซึ่งผู้ก่อตั้งเชื่อว่าจะมีขนาดใหญ่ราวกับหรือเกินกว่าตลาดทุนในปัจจุบัน นับตั้งแต่เปิดตัวในกลางเดือนธันวาคมที่ผ่านมา มีผู้ใช้งานมากกว่า 10,000 ราย ทำการซื้อขายมูลค่ากว่า 24 ล้านดอลลาร์บนแพลตฟอร์มดังกล่าว การปรับกลยุทธ์ครั้งนี้เกิดขึ้นในขณะที่ราคาหุ้นของ Gemini ตกลงประมาณ 23% นับจากต้นปี 2025 สะท้อนถึงภาวะถดถอยของหุ้นในภาคคริปโต แม้ว่า SEC จะยกฟ้องคดีต่อพี่น้องตระกูล Winklevoss ไปแล้วก็ตาม

EN

Gemini Space Station Inc. (GEMI) announced it will cease operations in the U.K., European Union, and Australia by April 2026, alongside a reduction of its staff by 25%. The exchange has suspended deposits and new account creation in these regions, instructing customers to sign up with eToro by the end of March to facilitate the withdrawal of their assets. The founders, Tyler and Cameron Winklevoss, stated that the decision to exit these markets stems from difficulties gaining traction, allowing the company to refocus its resources. Moving forward, Gemini intends to concentrate on the U.S. market and expand into prediction markets, a sector the founders believe will eventually surpass traditional capital markets. Since its debut in mid-December, Gemini Predictions has seen over 10,000 users trade more than $24 million. This strategic pivot occurs as Gemini's shares have fallen approximately 23% since the start of 2025, mirroring a broader downturn in crypto equities, even as the SEC recently dismissed a lawsuit against the Winklevoss twins.

Key Points

  • Gemini to shut down operations in the U.K., EU, and Australia by April 2026.
  • The exchange is reducing its workforce by 25% and partnering with eToro for customer offboarding.
  • Strategic pivot to focus resources on the U.S. market and expand prediction markets.
  • Gemini Predictions has seen $24 million in volume from 10,000 users since its December launch.
  • Company shares have dropped 23% since early 2025 despite an SEC lawsuit dismissal.

Article

Gemini to exit U.K., EU and Australia, reduce staff by 25%, and focus on U.S. and prediction markets The crypto exchange has instructed affected customers to sign up with eToro by the end of March for withdrawals, while deposits and new accounts have been suspended. Updated Feb 5, 2026, 5:14 p.m. Published Feb 5, 2026, 5:11 p.m. Gemini Space Station Inc. (GEMI) is shutting down operations in the U.K., the European Union (EU) and Australia. The crypto exchange is also reducing its staff by 25%, according to a blog post on Thursday that suggests it is focusing resources into prediction markets. STORY CONTINUES BELOW “Effective 6 April 2026, Gemini will be ceasing operations in the United Kingdom,” the crypto trading platform said in an email sent to customers seen by CoinDesk which does not mention Australia or Europe. “Starting 5 March 2026, all customer accounts in these regions will be placed in withdrawal mode.” New York-based Gemini stated that it had partnered with brokerage platform eToro to assist customers with their offboarding process. It instructed customers to sign up with eToro so they could “assist in transferring your assets.” Full closures of all accounts will follow in April, the New York-based company said. New account creation and incentive programs will also be disabled. Crypto equities have lagged broader markets as risk sentiment shifted in early 2026. While major stock indices have posted gains, leading digital-asset–linked equities have slid, reflecting waning investor appetite and tightening liquidity. This underperformance underscores a retrenchment of speculative capital from crypto-linked stocks. Tyler and Cameron Winklevoss, CEO and President of Gemini, cited difficulties gaining traction in the U.K., Europe and Australian markets as their reason for exiting them, while saying the U.S. has been great to them. “The reality is that America has the world’s greatest capital markets and America has always been where it’s at for Gemini,” they said. “So it's time for Gemini to focus and double down on America.” Tyler and Cameron also shared their view that prediction markets would outgrow capital markets, saying they have plans to venture into this sector. “Our thesis is that prediction markets will be as big or bigger than today’s capital markets,” they said. “Our investment in securing a license to launch our own prediction marketplace positions us as an early mover on this new and exciting frontier.” They added that more than 10,000 users have traded over $24 million since the debut of Gemini Predictions in mid-December. Gemini, which went public in September , has seen its shares fall about 23% since the start of 2025 amid a broader downturn in crypto prices. The stock was down 2.8% on Thursday. Read more: SEC dismisses lawsuit against billionaire Winklevoss twins-backed Gemini over Earn product
